sen.j: 小川 清助（おがわ せいすけ、1832年 - 1880年）は、幕末から明治初期にかけて伊豆半島南部で活躍した石工である。
sen.e: Seisuke OGAWA (1832 - 1880) was a stonemason and active in the southern part of Izu Peninsula from the end of Edo Period to early Meiji Period.
Seisuke OGAWA (1832 - 1880) was a stonemason active in the southern part of Izu Peninsula from the end of Edo Period to early Meiji Period.
Seisuke OGAWA (1832 - 1880) was a stonemason active in the southern part of Izu Peninsula from the end of Edo Period to early Meiji Period.

sen.j: その作品は現在、伊豆半島南端に近い静岡県下田市域で二十数点が確認されている。
sen.e: His works, 20 or more, are currently identified in Shimoda City area in Shizuoka Prefecture near the southern tip of Izu Peninsula.
His works, twenty or more, are currently identified in Shimoda City area in Shizuoka Prefecture near the southern tip of Izu Peninsula.
In Shimoda City area in Shizuoka Prefecture near the southern tip of Izu Peninsula, there are 20 or more works currently identified as Seisuke's work.
sen.cmt: 全体的に自然な文章に変更しました。

sen.j: 歴代清助
sen.e: Successive Seisuke
Successive Seisuke
History of successive 'Seisuke'
sen.cmt: 原文にあわせて修正しました。

sen.j: 小川清助の子孫に伝わる伝承によると、清助の名は江戸時代の延宝年間（1673年 - 1681年）に始まり、明治初期まで約200年にわたって世襲されたという。
sen.e: According to the tradition of Seisuke OGAWA's descendant, the name of Seisuke began in 1673 - 1681 during the Edo Period and it was inherited until the early Meiji Period for about 200 years.
According to the tradition of Seisuke OGAWA's descendant, the name Seisuke began in 1673 - 1681 during the Edo Period and it was inherited until the early Meiji Period for about 200 years.

According to the tradition of Seisuke OGAWA's descendant, the name 'Seisuke' was started to be used between 1673 - 1681 during the Edo Period and it was passed on to the next generation until the early Meiji Period for about 200 years.
sen.cmt: 全体的に自然な文章に変更しました。

sen.j: これを裏付けるように、「清助」銘を有する最古の作品として、早くから下田市西中・中村公園の地蔵菩薩立像（享保12年・1727年作）があげられてきた。
sen.e: To proof this, a standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu (Guardian deity of travelers and children), made in 1727, in Nakamura Park, Nishinaka, Shimoda City had been the oldest work which had inscription of "Seisuke", but the name of "Seisuke" cannot be identified in this statue at present and it is doubtful that this statue was made by Seisuke.
sen.cmt: 地蔵菩薩立像→standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu (Guardian deity of travelers and children)下田市西中→Nishinaka, Shimoda City
sen.e: To prove this, a standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu (Guardian deity of travelers and children), made in 1727, in Nakamura Park, Nishinaka, Shimoda City is the oldest work with an inscription about "Seisuke," but the name "Seisuke" cannot be identified on this statue at present and it is doubtful that this statue was made by Seisuke.

In order to confirm this, a standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu (Guardian deity of travelers and children), made in 1727, in Nakamura Park, Nishinaka, Shimoda City, was named as the oldest of his work with the inscription of 'Seisuke.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理自然な文章に変更しました。

sen.j: しかし現状では本像に「清助」の名は確認できず、この像が清助の作であるとする説は疑わしい。
sen.e: However now the name 'Seisuke' cannot be found on this statue and it is doubtful that this statue was made by Seisuke.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理自然な文章に変更しました。

sen.j: 現在「清助」銘を持つことが確認できる最古の作品は、下田市横川にある曹洞宗の古刹太梅寺門前に立つ地蔵菩薩立像であり、天保4年（1833年）の銘がある。
sen.e: Currently, the oldest work which the inscription "Seisuke" can be identified is the standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu which stands in front of Taibai-ji Temple, an ancient temple, in Yokokawa, Shimoda City, and it has the inscription of "1833".
sen.cmt: 太梅寺→Taibai-ji Temple下田市横川→Yokokawa, Shimoda City天保4年（1833年）の銘があるということで、年号に""をつけ加えました。
sen.e: Currently, the oldest work where the inscription "Seisuke" can be identified is the standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu which stands in front of Taibai-ji Temple, an ancient temple, in Yokokawa, Shimoda City, and it is inscribed as "1833."

Currently, the oldest work where the inscription 'Seisuke' can be identified is the standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu which stands in front of Taibai-ji Temple, an ancient temple in Yokokawa, Shimoda City, and there is an inscription of the year 1833.

sen.j: この年は最後の小川清助（1832年 - 1880年）が生まれた翌年にあたるため、少なくとも「清助」の名が2代に渡って世襲されたことが確認できる。
sen.e: This year was the following year of the last Seisuke OGAWA's (1832 - 1880) birth and it can be confirmed that the name of "Seisuke" had been inherited through at least two generations.
This year was the year following the last Seisuke OGAWA's (1832 - 1880) birth and it can be confirmed that the name of "Seisuke" has been inherited through at least two generations.
This year was the year following the birth of last Seisuke OGAWA (1832 - 1880) and it can be confirmed that the name of 'Seisuke' had been inherited through at least two generations.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。内容を少し変更しました。

sen.j: なおこの「先代清助」は最後の小川清助の祖父に当たると考えられるが（最後の小川清助の父は「辰蔵」の名で作品をのこしている）、この他に3点の作品が知られている。
sen.e: "Sendai Seisuke (the family predecessor of Seisuke OGAWA)" is considered as the grandfather of last Seisuke OGAWA (the father of the last Seisuke remained his works under the name of "Tatsuzo".), besides this, three works are known.
sen.cmt: 先代清助→"Sendai Seisuke (the family predecessor of Seisuke OGAWA)" 定訳不明辰蔵→Tatsuzo 読み方不明
sen.e: "Sendai Seisuke (the family predecessor of Seisuke OGAWA)" is considered as the grandfather of the last Seisuke OGAWA (the father of the last Seisuke left works under the name of "Tatsuzo") besides this, three works are known.

This 'former Seisuke' is considered to be the grandfather of the last Seisuke OGAWA (the father of the last Seisuke left works under the name of 'Tatsuzo') and there are three more works to be his besides the statue of Taibai-ji.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。()を' 'の外に移動させました。内容を修正しました。

sen.j: 先代清助の作品は造形的に特筆すべきところはなく、最後の小川清助の作品に見られるような優れた造形力と特徴的な作風が見られない。
sen.e: There was no significant point in carving of Sendai Seisuke's work and the outstanding carving and distinctive style which the last Seisuke had cannot be seen in the Sendai Seisuke's work.
There was no significant point in the carvings of Sendai Seisuke and the outstanding carving and distinctive style done by the last Seisuke, cannot be seen in Sendai Seisuke's work.
There is no significant characteristics in the carvings of the former Seisuke and the outstanding carving skill and distinctive style of the last Seisuke cannot be seen in his work.

sen.j: また、当時の清助は小川姓を名乗っていなかったようで、作品に小川姓が刻まれることはなかった。
sen.e: And Seisuke at that time did not identify himself as Ogawa, therefore his surname, Ogawa, had never been inscribed on his works.
And Seisuke at that time did not identify himself as Ogawa, therefore his surname, Ogawa, had never been inscribed on his creations.
Also Seisuke at that time did not identify himself as Ogawa, therefore his surname, Ogawa, had never been inscribed on his works.

sen.j: 小川清助の生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography of Seisuke OGAWA
sen.cmt: ほかの清助でなく、最後の「小川清助」ということなので、区別する必要があります。

sen.j: 修行時代
sen.e: Training time
Training time
Training time

sen.j: 小川清助の生涯に関しては文化 (元号)元年（1832年）に生まれ、明治13年（1880年）に48歳で亡くなったこと以外、断片的なエピソードが伝わっているだけでよくわかっていない。
sen.e: The life of Seisuke OGAWA is not well known, only fragmentary episodes were known, except that he was born in 1832 and died in 1880 at the age of 48.
The life of Seisuke OGAWA is not well known, only fragmentary episodes were known, except that he was born in 1832 and died in 1880 at the age of fourty-eight.
Except that he was born in 1832 and died in 1880 at the age of 48, the life of Seisuke OGAWA is not well known and there are only fragmentary episodes.

sen.j: 彼のもっとも若い頃の記録と考えられるのが、下田市柿崎 (下田市)、外浦海水浴場の一角に位置する燭光院の、本堂を建立した際に書かれた棟札である。
sen.e: The Munafuda (historical plaque on a building) which was written when building a main hall of Shokko-in Temple located in the corner of the Sotoura Seaside Resort, in Kakisaki, Shimoda City was considered as one of his youngest record.
sen.cmt: 柿崎→Kakisaki外浦海水浴場→Sotoura Seaside Resort燭光院→Shokko-in Temple 読み方不明
sen.e: The Munafuda (historical plaque on a building) written when building the main hall of the Shokko-in Temple located in the corner of the Sotoura Seaside Resort, in Kakisaki, Shimoda City was considered one of his earliest records.

The historical plaque, written when the main hall of the Shokko-in Temple located in the corner of the Sotoura Seaside Resort, in Kakisaki, Shimoda City was built, was considered to be one of his earliest records.
sen.cmt: 文章の流れを変更しました。

sen.j: この棟札は嘉永2年（1849年）の年名を持つが、ここには「石工 下田金七」の名に並び、「同脇 下田清助」の名が記されている。
sen.e: This Munafuda has the inscription of "1849", and "Kinshichi SHIMODA, the stonemason" as well as "Seisuke SHIMODA, the apprentice" are inscribed on this Munafuda.
sen.cmt: 下田金七→Kinshichi SHIMODA 読み方不明嘉永2年（1849年）の銘があるということで、年号に""をつけ加えました。同脇→apprentice 読み方、定訳不明＊漢字「脇」の意味と後続文（セル下）等を考慮した上で考えられる訳をつけました。
sen.e: This Munafuda has the inscription"1849," and "Kinshichi SHIMODA, the stonemason" as well as "Seisuke SHIMODA, his apprentice" are inscribed on this Munafuda.
This plaque has the inscription of the year 1849 and also there are names of 'Kinshichi SHIMODA, the stonemason' as well as 'Seisuke SHIMODA, his apprentice.'
sen.cmt: 文章の流れを変更しました。

sen.j: 20歳の小川清助がこのときどのような仕事に携わったのかはよくわからないが、彼が父の辰蔵ではなく、金七なる石工の元で修行していたことを物語る記録である。
sen.e: It is unknown what kind of work Seisuke OGAWA was involved at the age of 20, however this record tells that he was training with Kinshichi, the stonemason, not with his father (Tatsuzo).
It is unknown what kind of work Seisuke OGAWA was involved at the age of twenty, however this record says that he was training with Kinshichi, the stonemason, not with his father (Tatsuzo).
It is unknown what kind of work Seisuke OGAWA was involved at the age of twenty, however this record says that he was training with Kinshichi, the stonemason, not with his father (Tatsuzo).

sen.j: 20代の作品
sen.e: Works in his 20's
Works during his twenties
Works during his twenties

sen.j: 現在知られている小川清助最初の作品は、下田市相玉、相玉庚申堂の背後に迫る藤原山の山頂に立つ石塔である。
sen.e: The first work, currently-known, of Seisuke OGAWA was the stone pagoda which stands on the mountaintop of Mt. Fujiwara close behind Aitama Koshindo Temple in Aitama, Shimoda City.
sen.cmt: 下田市相玉→Aitama, Shimoda City相玉庚申堂→Aitama Koshindo Temple
sen.e: The first work, currently-known, of Seisuke OGAWA was the stone pagoda that stands on top of Mt. Fujiwara close behind Aitama Koshindo Temple in Aitama, Shimoda City.
The first work, currently-known, of Seisuke OGAWA was the stone pagoda that stands on top of Mt. Fujiwara close behind Aitama Koshindo Temple in Aitama, Shimoda City.

sen.j: この石塔は宝篋印塔の形をしているが、塔身正面に「天上 降臨 青面金剛明王塔」と刻まれているため、庚申塔であることが確認できる。
sen.e: Even if this stone pagoda is formed of Hokyointo (three-tiered stupa pagoda), it can be identified that this is the Koshinto Pagoda (Koshin is a folk faith in Japan and its object of devotion is Shomen Kongo) because the "The God above descended to this world, Shomen Kongo Myoo Pagoda" is inscribed in front of its body.
sen.cmt: 宝篋印塔→Hokyointo (three-tiered stupa pagoda) 定訳不明塔身→body天上 降臨 青面金剛明王塔→The God above descended to this world, Shomen Kongo Myoo Pagoda定訳不明庚申塔→Koshinto Pagoda(Koshin is a folk faith in Japan and its object of devotion is Shomen Kongo)カッコ内の補足文がないと、理解が難しいと思われたので、カッコ内の訳文をつけました。一原文一訳文の例外対象
sen.e: Even if this stone pagoda is formed of Hokyointo (three-tiered stupa pagoda), it can be identified as a Koshinto Pagoda (Koshin is a folk faith in Japan and its object of devotion is Shomen Kongo) because the "The God above descended to this world, Shomen Kongo Myoo Pagoda" is inscribed in front of its figure.

Although this stone pagoda has the form of Hokyointo (three-tiered stupa pagoda), it can be identified as a Koshinto Pagoda (Koshin is a folk faith in Japan and its object of devotion is a deity called Shomen Kongo) because the description, 'The God above descended to this world, Shomen Kongo Myoo Pagoda,' is inscribed in front of its figure.

sen.j: 小川清助の名はこの塔の台座背面に刻まれた7人の石工の筆頭として刻まれている。
sen.e: The name of Seisuke OGAWA is inscribed on the back of its base as the head the list of seven stonemasons.
sen.cmt: 台座→base一原文一訳文の例外対象
sen.e: The name of Seisuke OGAWA is inscribed on the back of its base heading a list of seven stonemasons.
The name of Seisuke OGAWA, listed at the top of seven stonemasons, is inscribed on the back.

sen.j: ところでこの塔の塔身左面には造塔の由来を記した長文の刻銘があるが、その後半に年銘があり、嘉永5年（1852年）の作であることがわかる。
sen.e: On the left part of the body of this pagoda, there is a long inscription which the origin of making this pagoda was written and "1852" is inscribed later on the inscription.
sen.cmt: 嘉永5年（1852年）の銘があるということで、年号に""をつけ加えました。
sen.e: On the left side of the figure of this pagoda, there is a long inscription concerning the origin of building this pagoda and "1852" is included in this inscription..

On the left side of the figure of this pagoda, there is a long inscription describing the origin of the building of this pagoda and there is a description of when it is built in the latter part which indicates that the pagoda is built in 1852.

sen.j: 嘉永5年当時小川清助は弱冠20歳の若者であり、そのような彼が石工たちの筆頭として銘文に名が見られる点は不自然とも考えられ、あるいは先代の作ではないかとも思われる。
sen.e: Seisuke OGAWA was only 20 years old in 1852 and it is unnatural that such a young man's name was the head the list of seven stonemasons, and thus it is believed that this pagoda was made by Sendai Seisuke.

Seisuke OGAWA was only twenty years old in 1852 and it is unusual for such a young man's name to be at the head a list of seven stonemasons, and thus it is believed that this pagoda was built by Sendai Seisuke.

Seisuke OGAWA was only twenty years old in 1852 and it is unusual for such a young man's name to be at the top of the list of seven stonemasons, and thus it is believed that this pagoda mighe have been built by former Seisuke.
sen.cmt: headの後にonを挿入しました。

sen.j: しかし後年、小川清助が制作で悩んだ際に相玉の庚申堂に篭っていたという伝承がある。
sen.e: However, there is a tradition that Seisuke OGAWA, later in his life, secluded himself at Koshindo Temple, in Aitama when he was struggle with his works.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対象
sen.e: However, there is a story that Seisuke OGAWA, later in his life, secluded himself at Koshindo Temple, in Aitama when he was struggling with his works.
However, there is a story that Seisuke OGAWA, later in his life, secluded himself at Koshindo Temple, in Aitama when he was struggling with his works.

sen.j: 彼と庚申堂の深い関係を思わせる点、小川姓を作品に刻するのが彼に始まったと思われる点などから、現時点ではこの塔の作者を小川清助とするのが穏当と考えられる。
sen.e: This tradition suggests that he had close connections in the Koshindo Temple and that he started to inscribe his surname, Ogawa, on his works, therefore it might be appropriate at this point to assume the stonemason of this pagoda was Seisuke OGAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対象
sen.e: This story suggests that he had close connections in the Koshindo Temple and that he started to inscribe his surname, Ogawa, on his works, therefore we can, at this point, assume the stonemason who built this pagoda was Seisuke OGAWA.

This story suggests that he had close connections with the Koshindo Temple and since he was the one to start inscribing his surname, Ogawa, on his works, we can, at this point, assume the stonemason who built this pagoda was Seisuke OGAWA.

sen.j: その後の小川清助は、21歳のときに下田市河内・重願寺の六地蔵を、28歳のときに下田八幡神社の石灯籠を制作している。
sen.e: Seisuke made the Roku Jizo (six Jizos) in Jugan-ji Temple, Kochi, Shimoda City at the age of 21, and a pair of stone lanterns in Shimoda Hachiman-jinja Shrine at the age of 28.
sen.cmt: 下田市河内→Kochi, Shimoda City重願寺→Jugan-ji Temple下田八幡神社→Shimoda Hachiman-jinja Shrine
sen.e: Seisuke created the Roku Jizo (six Jizos) in Jugan-ji Temple, Kochi, Shimoda City at the age of twenty-one, and a pair of stone lanterns in Shimoda Hachiman-jinja Shrine at the age of twenty-eight.
Seisuke created the Roku Jizo (six Jizos) in Jugan-ji Temple, Kochi, Shimoda City at the age of twenty-one, and a pair of stone lanterns in Shimoda Hachiman-jinja Shrine at the age of twenty-eight.

sen.j: 下田八幡神社は下田町の鎮守として下田町民の信仰を集めていた神社であった。
sen.e: Shimoda Hachiman-jinja Shrine gathered the belief of residents in Shimoda Town as Chinju (the guardian God) of the town.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対象
sen.e: Shimoda Hachiman-jinja Shrine was believe by the residents in Shimoda Town to be Chinju (the guardian God) of the town.
Shimoda Hachiman-jinja Shrine was worshipped by the residents in Shimoda Town because it enshrined the guardian God of the town.

sen.j: この神社に彼の作品がのこることは、21代後半の小川清助が、すでに下田町内で一定の評価を受けていたことを示している。
sen.e: His works were remained in this shrine and this shows that he already achieved appreciation from people in Shimoda Town at the age of his late 20's.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対象
sen.e: His works remain in this shrine and this shows that he was already appreciated by the people in Shimoda Town during his late twenties.
His works remain in this shrine and this shows that he was already appreciated by the people in Shimoda Town during his late twenties.

sen.j: なお、下田八幡神社には拝殿前にもう一対、小川清助作の石灯籠があったというが、近年の拝殿火災の際に失われたという。
sen.e: It is said that there were another pair of stone lanterns in front of a hall of worship in Shimoda Hachiman-jinja Shrine which were made by Seisuke OGAWA, but they had been burned down in recent years.
It is said that there were another pair of stone lanterns in front of a hall of worship in Shimoda Hachiman-jinja Shrine made by Seisuke OGAWA, but they had been destroyed in a fire in recent years.

It is said that there were another pair of stone lanterns in front of a hall of worship in Shimoda Hachiman-jinja Shrine made by Seisuke OGAWA, but it is said that they had been destroyed in a fire in recent years.

sen.j: また、小川清助は、下田市白浜の白浜神社の拝殿再建にも参加、白浜神社玉垣とそれに付属する小さな一対の狛犬に「下田石工 小川清助」の名を刻んでいる。
sen.e: Seisuke OGAWA was also participated in rebuilding the hall of worship of Shirahama-jinja Shrine in Shirahama, Shimoda City and he inscribed the name of "Seisuke OGAWA, the stonemason in Shimoda," on fences surrounding the shrine and a pair of small Komainu (stone-carved guardian dogs).
sen.cmt: 下田市白浜→Shirahama, Shimoda City狛犬→Komainu(s) (stone-carved guardian dogs).
sen.e: Seisuke OGAWA also participated in rebuilding the hall of worship of in Shirahama, Shimoda City on which he inscribed the name of "Seisuke OGAWA, the stonemason in Shimoda," on fences surrounding the shrine and a pair of small Komainus (stone-carved guardian dogs).

Seisuke OGAWA also participated in rebuilding the hall of worship in Shirahama-jinja Shrine, in Shirahama, Shimoda City on which he inscribed the name of 'Seisuke OGAWA, the stonemason in Shimoda,' on fences surrounding the shrine and a pair of small stone-carved guardian dogs.

sen.j: この狛犬と玉垣にはそれぞれ、万延元年（1860年）、文久元年（1861年）の銘があり、小川清助28歳、29歳の作である。
sen.e: Each of the fences and Komainus was inscribed with "1860" and "1861" and made by Seisuke OGAWA at the age of 28 and 29.
sen.cmt: 万延元年（1860年）、文久元年（1861年）の銘があるということで、年号に""をつけ加えました。
sen.e: Each of the fences and Komainus are inscribed with "1860" and "1861" and were made by Seisuke OGAWA at the age of twenty-eight and twenty-nine.
Each of the fences and gurdian dogs are inscribed with 1860 and 1861 respectively and were made by Seisuke OGAWA at the age of 28 and 29.

sen.j: 30代の作品
sen.e: Works in his 30's
Works during his thirties
Works during his thirties

sen.j: 30代は小川清助がもっとも意欲的に制作活動を行った時期である。
sen.e: Most active period in Seisuke OGAWA's works was in his 30's.
Most active period in Seisuke OGAWA's works was during his thirties.
Most active period in Seisuke OGAWA's history was during his thirties.

sen.j: この時期の清助は引き続き白浜神社の仕事を継続しており、拝殿正面、総高250cmをこえる石燈籠（1864年、32歳の作）に名を刻んでいる。
sen.e: Seisuke continued to work in Shirahama-jinja Shrine and inscribed his name on the stone lantern (in 1864, aged 32), its total height is over 250 cm, in front of a hall of worship.
Seisuke continued to work on Shirahama-jinja Shrine and inscribed his name on the stone lantern (in 1864, aged 32), its total height is over 250 cm, in front of the hall of worship.
Seisuke continued to work on Shirahama-jinja Shrine and inscribed his name on the stone lantern (in 1864, aged 32) with more than 250 cm in height which was located in front of the hall of worship.

sen.j: また、下田市一丁目の須崎町稲荷神社の一対の神狐、下田市河内の諏訪神社の大型の狛犬、下田市河内・満昌寺の馬頭観音坐像など、彼の代表作の多くがこの時期に作られている。
sen.e: Many of his outstanding works had been made during this period, such as a pair of spiritual foxes in Inari-jinja Shrine, Suzaki-cho, 1-chome, Shimoda City, a pair of big Komainus in Suwa-jinja Shrine, Kochi, Shimoda City, or the seated statue of Bato Kannon (horse-headed Kannon) in Mansho-ji Temple, Kochi, Shimoda City.
sen.cmt: 須崎町→Suzaki-cho神狐→spiritual fox馬頭観音坐像→seated statue of Bato Kannon (horse-headed Kannon)
sen.e: Many of his outstanding works had been made during this period, such as a pair of spiritual foxes in Inari-jinja Shrine, Suzaki-cho, 1-chome, Shimoda City, a pair of big stone-carved guardian dogs in Suwa-jinja Shrine, Kochi, Shimoda City, or the seated statue of Bato Kannon (horse-head Kannon) in Mansho-ji Temple, Kochi, Shimoda City.

Many of his outstanding works had been made during this period, such as a pair of spiritual foxes in Inari-jinja Shrine, Suzaki-cho, 1-chome, Shimoda City, a pair of big stone-carved guardian dogs in Suwa-jinja Shrine, Kochi, Shimoda City, or the seated statue of Bato Kannon (horse-head Kannon) in Mansho-ji Temple, Kochi, Shimoda City.

sen.j: なお、小川家の伝承によれば、小川清助は下田港の沖、11kmに浮かぶ神子元島に神子元島灯台を建造する際、石工として腕を振るったと言う。
sen.e: Due to the tradition of the Ogawa family, Seisuke OGAWA used all his abilities of stonemason in building the Mikomotoshima Lighthouse on Mikomoto-jima Island, about 11 km from Shimoda Port.
sen.cmt: 神子元島灯台→Mikomotoshima Lighthouse神子元島→Mikomoto-jima Island
sen.e: Due to the tradition of the Ogawa family, Seisuke OGAWA used all his abilities of stonemason in building the Mikomotoshima Lighthouse on Mikomoto-jima Island, about eleven kilometers from Shimoda Port.

According to the tradition of the Ogawa family, Seisuke OGAWA used all his abilities of stonemason in building the Mikomotoshima Lighthouse on Mikomoto-jima Island, about eleven kilometers from Shimoda Port.

sen.j: この伝承の可否は確認できないが、伝承を信じるならば、神子元島灯台の完成は明治3年（1870年）であり、現在、小川清助の34歳、36歳、37歳の作品が確認されていないのは、灯台建造に携わっていたためとも考えられる。
sen.e: It is unknown whether the tradition is right or wrong, however, if the tradition is believed, the completion of Mikomotoshima Lighthouse was in 1870 and Seisuke OGAWA's works at the age of 34, 36 and 37 were not identified because he had been working to build the lighthouse.

It is unknown whether the tradition is correct or not, however, if true, the completion of the Mikomotoshima Lighthouse was in 1870 and Seisuke OGAWA's works at the age of thirty-four, thirty-six, and thirty-seven were not identified because he had been working to build the lighthouse.

It is unknown whether the tradition is correct or not, however, if true, the completion of the Mikomotoshima Lighthouse was in 1870 and Seisuke OGAWA's works at the age of 34, 36, and 37 were not identified because he had been working to build the lighthouse.
sen.cmt: thirty-four, thirty-six, and thirty-sevenを34, 36 and 37に変更しました。

sen.j: 40代の事績
sen.e: Achievements in his 40's
Achievements in his fourties
Achievements in his forties

sen.j: 40代の清助は、明治10年（1873年）東京上野恩賜公園で開催された第一回内国勧業博覧会に作品を出展し、自分の技術を世に問うている。
sen.e: Seisuke, in his 40's, exhibited his works at the National Industrial Exhibition in Ueno Onshi Park, Tokyo in 1873 and appealed to the public for his skill.
Seisuke, in his fourties, exhibited his work at the National Industrial Exhibition in Ueno Onshi Park, Tokyo in 1873 and appealed to the public for his skill.
Seisuke, in his forties, exhibited his works at the National Industrial Exhibition in Ueno Onshi Park, Tokyo in 1873 and appealed to the public for his skill.

sen.j: この時の彼の出展作品は「関羽印」「聨（れん）」「書画」「青石」「石器」の5点。
sen.e: His exhibits for this exhibition were five; "Kanu-in", "Ren", "Shoga", "Aoishi", and "Sekki".
sen.cmt: 関羽印→Kanu-in聨→Ren書画→Shoga青石→Aoishi石器→Sekki読み方不明後続の文に説明文があるので、読み方のみにとどめました。
sen.e: His exhibits numbered five; "Kanu-in," "Ren," "Shoga," "Aoishi," and "Sekki."
He exhibited five of his works: 'Kanu-in,' 'Ren,' 'Shoga,' 'Aoishi,' and 'Sekki.'

sen.j: いずれも石製品であったと考えられ、聨は漢詩や書画を刻した細長い石版、書画は同じく石造のレリーフ、石器は石笛であったとされており、青石も何らかの彫刻と考えられるが詳細は不明である。
sen.e: It is believed that all of his exhibits were stone objects, but the details of each works were unknown, "Ren" was a spindly lithograph which Chinese poetry and calligraphic works or paintings were inscribed, "Shoga" was a stone relief, "Sekki" was a stone flute, and "Aoishi" was some sort of sculpture.

It is believed that all of his exhibits were stone objects, but the details of each work are unknown, "Ren" was a spindly lithograph on which Chinese poetry and calligraphic works or paintings were inscribed, "Shoga" was a stone relief, "Sekki" was a stone flute, and "Aoishi" was some sort of sculpture.

It is believed that all of his exhibits were stone objects, but the details of each work are unknown; "Ren" was a spindly lithograph on which Chinese poetry and calligraphic works or paintings were inscribed, "Shoga" was a stone relief, "Sekki" was a stone flute, and "Aoishi" was some sort of sculpture.

sen.j: これらの作品は、残念ながら現在いずれも所在不明となっているが、清助は河内諏訪神社の狛犬の台石に、自分の名とともに精緻な彫りで印面を刻み込んでおり、ここに見られる印面は「関羽印」を想像する上で参考になるだろう。
sen.e: Unfortunately, the locations of these works were not identified, Seisuke inscribed a stamping surface as well as his name with a significant carving on the footstone of Komainu in Suwa-jinja Shrine, Kochi, and its stamping surface can be helpful to imagine "Kanu-in".
sen.cmt: 台石→footstone河内諏訪神社→Suwa-jinja Shrine in Kochi
sen.e: Unfortunately, the locations of these works were not identified, Seisuke inscribed a stamping surface including his name with a significant carving on the footstone of Komainu in Suwa-jinja Shrine, Kochi, and its stamping surface can be helpful to imagine "Kanu-in."

Although unfortunately whereabouts of these works were unknown, Seisuke inscribed his name and the surface of his stamp exquisitely on the footstone of guardinan dogs in Suwa-jinja Shrine, Kochi, and this curving of stamp can be helpful to imagine his lost work of 'Kanu-in.'
sen.cmt: 原文にあわせて内容を修正しました。

sen.j: この時の作品で最も興味深いのは「石器」こと石笛であり、清助はこの石笛で褒賞を受賞。
sen.e: The most fascinating works on this occasion was a stone flute, "Sekki", and Seisuke won the incentive award for it.
The most fascinating work was a stone flute, "Sekki," and Seisuke won an incentive award for it.
The most fascinating work was a stone flute, 'Sekki,' and Seisuke won an incentive award for it.

sen.j: 現在、清助の子孫の家に褒状のみ現存している。
sen.e: Currently, only the award certificate exists in the house of Seisuke's descendant.
Currently, only the award certificate exists in the house of Seisuke's descendant.
Currently, only the award certificate exists in the house of Seisuke's descendant.

sen.j: 褒状には「軟石ヲ密鐫シテ刀痕鮮明ナリ其石笛ハ発音未タ正律ニ協ハスト雖モ朗爽トシテ渋滞ナキハ鐫鑿ノ宜キニ因ヲ観ル」と受賞理由が明記され、これによって失われた石笛が軟石を緻密に彫刻したものであること、その笛が音階こそ整っていないものの爽やかな音色を奏でたことを知ることができる。
sen.e: In the certificate, reasons for the award were written; 'The stone flute was carved from freestone with elaborateness, and although its music scale was off-key, the sound was brilliant.'
sen.cmt: 褒状の内容が「」後の文で説明されています。全文を訳すと重複するので、全体をまとめるという形で、''内に訳しました。
sen.e: On the certificate, reasons for the award are written; 'The stone flute was carved from freestone and was elaborate, and although its music scale was off-key, the sound was brilliant.'
On the certificate, reasons for the award are written; 'The stone flute was carved from freestone and was elaborate, and although its music scale was off-key, the sound was brilliant.'

sen.j: 笛の種類は特定できないが、音階があることから、複数の穴を配して音階を変えることの出来る横笛か、尺八のような縦笛であったのだろう。
sen.e: Although the type of flute cannot be indentified, it could be a transverse flute or an end-blown flute such as Shakuhachi bamboo flute which can shift the scale by using several holes on it because the certificate said about music scale.

Although the type of flute cannot be indentified, it could be a transverse flute or an end-blown flute such as Shakuhachi bamboo flute which can shift the scale by using several holes on it because the certificate identifies a music scale.

Although the type of flute cannot be indentified, it could be a transverse flute or an end-blown flute such as Shakuhachi bamboo flute which can shift the scale by using several holes on it because the certificate refers to a music scale.
sen.cmt: 原文にあわせて内容を修正しました。

sen.j: なお、清助はこれらの作品の他に、球状の石が入った石の壺、石のテーブル、石のコーヒーカップなどを制作したというが、残念ながらいずれも現存していない。
sen.e: Seisuke also made a stone pot with spherical stone in it, a stone table, and a stone coffee cup, but unfortunately, they do not exist.
Seisuke also made a stone pot with spherical stone in it, a stone table, and a stone coffee cup, but unfortunately, they do not exist at present.
Seisuke also made a stone pot with spherical stone in it, a stone table, and a stone coffee cup, but unfortunately, they do not exist at present.

sen.j: 一方40代の清助の作品は現在一点が確認されているのみである。
sen.e: There is only one Seisuke's work that was identified in his 40's.
There is only one Seisuke's work that was identified done in his fourties.
There is only one work of Seisuke identified as the work created during his forties.

sen.j: その貴重な作例が下田市横川、太梅寺の子安地蔵坐像で、角柱型の尼僧の供養塔の上部に、蓮台に片足を踏み下げて坐す地蔵菩薩の像を刻んだ作品である。
sen.e: The valuable work is a seated statue of Koyasu Jizo in Taibai-ji Temple and this is the one which carved a seated statue of Jizo Bosatsu (Guardian deity for children and pregnancy), which its one leg stepped upon a lotus pedestal, on the top of the memorial pagoda for a prismatic-shaped Buddhist nun.
sen.cmt: 下田市横川→Yokokawa, Shimoda City子安地蔵坐像→seated statue of Koyasu Jizo (Guardian deity for children and pregnancy)定訳不明角柱型→prismatic-shaped
sen.e: The valuable work is a seated statue of Koyasu Jizo in Taibai-ji Temple and this is the one where a carved seated statue of Jizo Bosatsu (Guardian deity for children and pregnancy), with one leg standing upon a lotus pedestal, on the top of the memorial pagoda for a prismatic-shaped Buddhist nun.

The valuable work is a seated statue of Koyasu Jizo in Taibai-ji Temple in Yokokawa, Shimoda city, and this is the one where a seated statue of Jizo Bosatsu (Guardian deity for children and pregnancy), with one leg standing upon a lotus pedestal, curved on the top of the prismatic-shaped memorial pagoda for a Buddhist nun.
sen.cmt: 原文にあわせて内容を修正しました。

sen.j: 地蔵菩薩は下膨れで、蚕の繭形を呈する円満な慈悲相を浮かべて正面を見つめ、左腕には赤子を抱いている。
sen.e: The Jizo Bosatsu is a pudgy-cheeked and is staring at front with a peaceful beneficent look on its face, shape like a cocoon, holding a baby in its left hand.
The Jizo Bosatsu is pudgy-cheeked and is staring forward with a peaceful benevolent look on its face, shape like a cocoon, holding a baby in its left arm.
The pudgy-cheeked Jizo Bosatsu is staring forward with a peaceful benevolent look which is reminiscent of cocoon on its face and holding a baby in its left arm.
sen.cmt: 原文にあわせて内容を修正しました。

sen.j: また、地蔵菩薩の右膝元にも一人の童子がいて、地蔵にすがりつきながら温顔を仰ぎ見るようにしている様子が愛らしい。
sen.e: And there is a statue of child at Jizo Bosatsu's right knee, and it is adorable the statue is clinging onto Jizo Bosatsu and looking up its peaceful face.
And there is a statue of an adorable child at the right knee of Jizo Bosatsu, and he is clinging onto Jizo Bosatsu and looking up its peaceful face.
And there is a statue of an adorable child at the right knee of Jizo Bosatsu, and he is clinging onto Jizo Bosatsu and looking up its peaceful face.

sen.j: 小川清助の代表作である本像は、明治11年（1878年）、清助46歳の作品で、現在確認されている中では彼の最後の作品である。
sen.e: This statue, the outstanding work of Seisuke OGAWA in 1878, at the age of 46, was his last work which is currently identified.
This statue, the outstanding work of Seisuke OGAWA in 1878, at the age of fourty-six, was his last work currently identified.
This outstanding work of Seisuke OGAWA of 1878, at the age of 46, is currently known as his last work.

sen.j: 小川清助はこの像を造立した翌々年の明治13年（1880年）12月22日、下田新町で永眠した。
sen.e: Seisuke OGAWA died in Shinmachi, Shimoda on December 22, 1880 two years after he built this statue.
Seisuke OGAWA died in Shinmachi, Shimoda on December 22, 1880 two years after he built this statue.
Seisuke OGAWA died in Shinmachi, Shimoda on December 22, 1880, two years after he built this statue.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。

sen.j: 法名は雙轉清樹信士。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Souten Seiju Shinshi.
sen.cmt: 雙轉清樹信士→Souten Seiju Shinshi読み方不明
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Souten Seiju Shinshi.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Souten Seiju Shinshi.

sen.j: 48歳であった。
sen.e: He was 48 years old.
He was fourty-eight years old.
He was 48 years old.

sen.j: そしてこの「清助」の死とともに、世襲された「石工清助」の名は断絶した。
sen.e: With the death of this 'Seisuke', the name of "Seisuke, the stonemason" was ended.
With the death of this 'Seisuke,' the name of "Seisuke, the stonemason" ended.
With the death of this 'Seisuke,' the name of "Seisuke, the stonemason" ended.
